name: Drill
description: Originated in Chicago in the early 2010s; broadly characterized by complex, energetic rhythms coupled with gang-oriented, street-conscious, and violent lyrics.

children.name: Chicago Drill
children.description: Bass-heavy, dense, and typically syncopated percussion, featuring ticking hi-hats and gunshot-like snare rolls, usually accompanied by menacing synth melodies and violent Gangsta Rap lyricism.

children.name: Free Car Music
children.description: Chaotic and metallic percussion with clanging rides, rapid hi hat rolls, and tense kick buildups typically coupled with staggered, punched-in rapping.

children.name: Jersey Drill
children.description: Mixes Drill and Jersey Club production, characterized by an energetic sound and distinct syncopated rhythms.

children.name: New York Drill
children.description: Emerged in the late 2010s, characterized by energetic, bouncy tresillo rhythms, creating a warmer, more booming tone than UK Drill, which prominently inspired it.

children.name: Philly Drill
children.description: Apocalyptic and haunting choirs, keys, and strings with gruesome narratives and slow, sparse drums.

children.name: UK Drill
children.description: Deep bass and complex rhythm which denotes a Grime influence in the production.
